greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of sequences in {1,...,n}^n with longest increasing subsequence of length k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..18, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(b(n-1, [seq(min(l[j],
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n-1, Table[Min[l[[j]], If[j == 1 || l[[j-1]]<i, i, l[[j]]]], {j, 1, Length[l]}]], {i, 1, l[[-1]]}]]; A[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, If[n == 0, 1, 0], b[n, Array[n&, k]]]; T[n_, k_] := A[n, k] - If[k == 0, 0, A[n, k-1]]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 9}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 04 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 28 2014
